bibl.title: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Wade Hampton Frost, [1930]

div1.p: Carter is keeping certain materials Frost sent her because she understands he doesn't need them back until she next visits him.

div1.head: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Wade Hampton Frost, [1930]
div1.opener:
The Westmoreland,
2122 California St., N. W.,
Washington, D. C.
Dr. Wade H. Frost,
School of Hygiene and Public Health,
615 North Wolfe Street,
Baltimore, Maryland.
Dear Jack:
div1.p:
Re my letter of March 9, 1930, I put off returning the material
I mentioned in that connection, i. e. (a) Sec. 1. library cards: (b)
Sec. 1. bibliography in alphabetical order (your draft): (c) Sec. 1, a
second bibliography in alphabetic order, somewhat changed from your
draft and submitted for your approval.

The reason I have not yet sent the above is that, on re-reading
your letter (Feb. 12/30) transmitting (a) and (b), as well as other
material, I more fully took in the fact that you would not need the
material prior to my next trip to Baltimore. If, however, Mrs. Smiley
has finished, or nearly finished, re-copying Section ii and you wish
her to do any bibliographic work, while waiting for more of the finally
edited text, please ask Miss Fredericks to so advise me and I will send
over the material at once.
With love to the Susans and very best remembrances to yourself,

closer.seg:
P. S. Re (c) above: I did not, as I intended when I last wrote you,
type the whole of the alphabetic bibliography (Section 1),
submitted for your approval, because, if we are to have only
one bibliography at the end of the book, it would have been a
waste of time. I only typed two “sample pages,” in order to
illustrate the changes suggested in my letter of March 9, 1930.
L.A.C.
